00:00:02:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:02:050000.Dialogue: It's amazing people keep coming visit tvshowslatest.blogspot.com to comic book stores instead of just downloading comics digitally.

00:00:08:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:08:100000.Dialogue: It's probably for the best. For a lot of these guys, the weekly trip here is the only chance their mom has to go down to the basement and change their sheets.

00:00:17:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:17:040000.Dialogue: Oh, that reminds me, I get fresh sheets tonight. Yay.

00:00:22:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:22:230000.Dialogue: Well? What do you think of New Comic Book Night? Magic, huh?

00:00:28:220000.Speaker: Amy
00:00:28:220000.Dialogue: Sheldon, I'm disappointed. As a brilliant man, you're entitled to a vice. I could understand frequenting an opium den or hunting your fellow man for sport.

00:00:42:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:42:150000.Dialogue: Well, A) Comic books employ storytelling through sequential art, an medium that dates back 17,000 years to the cave paintings of Lascaux, and B) You play the harp. Like that's cool.

00:00:57:060000.Speaker: Stuart
00:00:57:060000.Dialogue: Can I help you find anything?

00:00:59:150000.Speaker: Amy
00:00:59:150000.Dialogue: A comic that depicts a woman whose bosom can't be used as a flotation device.

00:01:04:170000.Speaker: Stuart
00:01:04:170000.Dialogue: Sorry. Most of the guys who come in here like big boobs. Couple of them have big boobs.

00:01:12:000000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:12:000000.Dialogue: Hey, look, the new Warlords of Ka'a expansion pack is out.

00:01:15:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:15:080000.Dialogue: A new one? Unbelievable. They just keep making up more cheesy monsters, slapping them on cards and selling them at 25 bucks a pop. It's like a secret tax on guys who can't get laid.

00:01:27:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:27:200000.Dialogue: They're not even trying. Remember the Satanimals pack with the Hellephant? Why, absurd. What was he, a bad elephant who died and went to hell?

00:01:34:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:34:230000.Dialogue: What could an elephant possibly do that would cause him eternal damnation?

00:01:39:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:39:180000.Dialogue: Wild West and Witches? What kind of loser cares about a showdown between Billy the Kid and the White Wizard of the North?

00:01:48:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:48:110000.Dialogue: A total loser. Obviously, a guy with a six-shooter beats an old man with a magic wand.

00:01:58:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:58:090000.Dialogue: Uh, what if the wizard casts a Helmet of Confusion spell on Billy the Kid's cowboy hat?

00:02:03:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:03:110000.Dialogue: What? Please! This is Billy the Kid we're talking about. I mean, the wizard would get shot between the eyes before he could ever get out the words, What the hell is Billy the Kid doing in the mystic realm of Ka'a?

00:02:14:050000.Speaker: Stuart
00:02:14:050000.Dialogue: Leonard. What's the deal with Sheldon's friend Amy? Are they a couple?

00:02:24:100000.Speaker: Stuart
00:02:24:100000.Dialogue: Well, I mean, she didn't look through me with soul-sucking, ball-shriveling hatred and contempt.

00:02:31:140000.Speaker: Stuart
00:02:31:140000.Dialogue: I like that in a woman.

00:02:34:160000.Speaker: Stuart
00:02:34:160000.Dialogue: Could you run it by Sheldon if I could ask her out?

00:02:38:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:38:090000.Dialogue: KOOTHRAPPALI: Stuart, settle an argument for us. Who would win, Billy the Kid or the White Wizard?

00:02:43:220000.Speaker: Stuart
00:02:43:220000.Dialogue: If I tell you that, I'm robbing you of the hours of fun you could have for the magical, rootin'-tootin' low price of $24.95.

00:02:58:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:58:090000.Dialogue: I hate all of you and myself. Three.

00:03:02:070000.Speaker: Stuart
00:03:02:070000.Dialogue: I'll ring it up. Like shooting nerds in a barrel.

00:03:35:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:35:070000.Dialogue: Hey, can I talk to you about something? It's a little awkward.

00:03:39:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:39:150000.Dialogue: I know what this is about. Given the professional standstill you're at, you're wondering if this is the appropriate time to abandon your research and focus on teaching.

00:03:57:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:57:060000.Dialogue: And if I may suggest, consider changing disciplines. Yeah, to the humanities-- perhaps history. One of the advantages of teaching history is that you don't have to create things.

00:04:08:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:08:010000.Dialogue: You know, you just have to remember stuff that happened and then parrot it back. You could have fun with that.

00:04:16:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:16:110000.Dialogue: Yeah, that's not it. Stuart's kind of interested in Amy.

00:04:20:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:20:160000.Dialogue: Oh, of course he is. She's very interesting. Did you know, when she was 14, she severed the webbing between her own toes?

00:04:29:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:29:130000.Dialogue: No. He wanted me to find out if you'd have a problem with him asking her out.

00:04:38:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:38:230000.Dialogue: I'm not sure how to respond, Leonard.

00:04:42:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:42:030000.Dialogue: I don't own Amy. Can't own a person. At least not since...

00:05:01:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:01:130000.Dialogue: Slaves! Come on, Leonard, if you're going to teach history, these are the kind of facts you'll have to know.

00:05:07:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:07:230000.Dialogue: You know what? Never mind. I'm going to tell him it's okay to ask her out.

00:05:12:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:12:030000.Dialogue: The question is moot. There is no way that Stuart, an impoverished peddler of picture books, would be at all appealing to Amy Farrah Fowler, a noted neurobiologist capable of performing surgery on her own feet with nothing but nitrous oxide from cans of whipped cream as anesthesia.

00:05:30:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:30:090000.Dialogue: All right, but for the record, I checked in with you to see how you'd feel about it.

00:05:35:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:35:080000.Dialogue: Fine. The record shall so reflect. Now, getting back to the problem at hand, what to do with a washed-up experimental physicist...

00:05:48:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:48:010000.Dialogue: Oh, Leonard. Lots of people love you and want to help you, but they can't until you admit the problem.

00:05:59:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:59:050000.Dialogue: Well, ladies, we killed the bottle.

00:06:08:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:08:070000.Dialogue: So, what do you want to do-- go to the movies, go dancing, lay down for a little bit?

00:06:21:210000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:21:210000.Dialogue: Excuse me. I've passed many an enjoyable evening playing this game. And I'm sure it's a lot more exciting when you play with other people.

00:06:30:060000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:30:060000.Dialogue: What do you say, bestie? We can do shirts and skins. I'm shirts. Called it.

00:06:37:110000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:06:37:110000.Dialogue: I'm too small for Twister. And roller coasters. And sitting with my feet on the floor.

00:06:44:040000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:06:44:040000.Dialogue: Hope you enjoyed the prenatal cigarettes, Mom.

00:06:50:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:50:070000.Dialogue: Hey, you know, my mom smoked pot when she was pregnant with me, and I turned out just fine. Hey, look, I have peach schnapps. Thank God.

00:07:01:120000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:01:120000.Dialogue: I think a boy likes me.

00:07:06:150000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:07:06:150000.Dialogue: We met at the comic book store. I was wondering if you'd like to get coffee sometime. It's okay if you say no. It might be the kick in the pants I need to start taking Zoloft.

00:07:18:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:18:090000.Dialogue: Amy, little vixen. Just working it under all those layers of wool and polyester.

00:07:24:090000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:07:24:090000.Dialogue: What are you going to do? Doesn't he know you have a boyfriend?

00:07:27:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:27:210000.Dialogue: Oh, she doesn't have a boyfriend; she has a Sheldon.

00:07:33:120000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:33:120000.Dialogue: I don't know. He's nice. He's funny. He has the sallow, drawn countenance associated with an overactive thyroid gland. That's kind of hot.

00:07:43:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:43:130000.Dialogue: Okay, look, sweetie, we all love Sheldon, but you've been with him over a year now. If it's not going anywhere, what does it hurt to look around?

00:07:50:020000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:07:50:020000.Dialogue: Well, yeah, I guess they're not engaged like me and Howie.

00:07:53:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:53:140000.Dialogue: Yeah, for what it's worth, engaged people can look around, too. Lot of options out there.

00:08:13:230000.Speaker: Speccy Guy
00:08:13:230000.Dialogue: I'm Dale. He left me in charge.

00:08:20:140000.Speaker: Dale
00:08:20:140000.Dialogue: Yeah. I don't get it, either.

00:08:26:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:26:060000.Dialogue: I want to return this Wild West and Witches Ka'a expansion pack.

00:08:31:060000.Speaker: Dale
00:08:31:060000.Dialogue: Sorry. I don't do returns. They're hard.

00:08:39:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:39:020000.Dialogue: Uh, when will Stuart be back?

00:08:40:180000.Speaker: Dale
00:08:40:180000.Dialogue: I don't know. He went out for coffee. With a girl.

00:08:46:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:46:160000.Dialogue: Oh, I guess I was wrong.

00:08:52:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:52:040000.Dialogue: Am I okay? Leonard, I'm on a lifelong trajectory that includes a Nobel Prize and cities named after me, all four wisdom teeth fit comfortably in my mouth without need of extraction, and my bowel movements run like a German train schedule.

00:09:22:110000.Scene: The apartment. They are playing Warlords of Ka’a.
00:09:22:110000.Speaker: Raj

00:09:27:090000.Scene: The apartment. They are playing Warlords of Ka’a.
00:09:27:090000.Speaker: Leonard

00:09:35:030000.Scene: The apartment. They are playing Warlords of Ka’a.
00:09:35:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:35:030000.Dialogue: Flaming Spittoon. And for the record, I'm very disappointed in you cowpokes. We're playing our inaugural round of Wild West and Witches, and I'm the only one who bothered to dress for the occasion.

00:09:48:000000.Scene: The apartment. They are playing Warlords of Ka’a.
00:09:48:000000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:50:190000.Scene: The apartment. They are playing Warlords of Ka’a.
00:09:50:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:50:190000.Dialogue: We're not wearing cowboy hats, Sheldon. It looks ridiculous.

00:09:54:140000.Scene: The apartment. They are playing Warlords of Ka’a.
00:09:54:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:54:140000.Dialogue: And I suppose my boots and spurs are ridiculous, too?

00:09:58:200000.Scene: The apartment. They are playing Warlords of Ka’a.
00:09:58:200000.Speaker: Howard

00:10:01:070000.Scene: The apartment. They are playing Warlords of Ka’a.
00:10:01:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:01:070000.Dialogue: Did it look ridiculous when we got the Satanimals pack and I dressed up as a Beelzebobcat?

00:10:08:140000.Scene: The apartment. They are playing Warlords of Ka’a.
00:10:08:140000.Speaker: Howard

00:10:12:020000.Scene: The apartment. They are playing Warlords of Ka’a.
00:10:12:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:12:020000.Dialogue: All right, fine. Let's just play.

00:10:13:230000.Scene: The apartment. They are playing Warlords of Ka’a.
00:10:13:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:13:230000.Dialogue: We should go easy on him. Amy's out with Stuart tonight.

00:10:17:100000.Scene: The apartment. They are playing Warlords of Ka’a.
00:10:17:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:17:100000.Dialogue: Wait a minute. Are you telling me that Sheldon's patented blend of condescension and no sex isn't enough to hold on to a woman?

00:10:30:080000.Scene: The apartment. They are playing Warlords of Ka’a.
00:10:30:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:30:080000.Dialogue: Cluck, cluck, cluck. What are we, ladies at a quilting bee? Or are we men playing a fantasy card game set in a magical frontier town?

00:10:39:180000.Scene: The apartment. They are playing Warlords of Ka’a.
00:10:39:180000.Speaker: Howard

00:10:45:080000.Scene: The apartment. They are playing Warlords of Ka’a.
00:10:45:080000.Speaker: Raj

00:10:50:070000.Scene: The apartment. They are playing Warlords of Ka’a.
00:10:50:070000.Speaker: Leonard

00:10:53:010000.Scene: The apartment. They are playing Warlords of Ka’a.
00:10:53:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:53:010000.Dialogue: And may I point out it is the three of you who are obsessed with Stuart and Amy, not me. I think you need to ask yourselves who's really being ridiculous here.

00:11:10:090000.Scene: The apartment. They are playing Warlords of Ka’a.
00:11:10:090000.Speaker: Howard

00:11:15:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:15:010000.Dialogue: Hey, guys, check it out. The deluxe limited edition Wild West and Witches expansion pack in the signed and numbered collector's tin.

00:11:21:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:21:220000.Dialogue: LEONARD: Come on, no! We just bought the regular pack.

00:11:37:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:37:120000.Dialogue: I'm in the matrix, Leonard; I see everything.

00:11:40:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:40:030000.Dialogue: You got to be kidding me. You friended Stuart on Facebook?

00:11:44:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:44:040000.Dialogue: I thought you didn't like Facebook anymore.

00:11:46:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:46:010000.Dialogue: Don't be silly. I'm a fan of anything that tries to replace actual human contact.

00:11:50:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:50:170000.Dialogue: KOOTHRAPPALI: Please. You're looking at Facebook to find out how their date went.

00:11:55:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:55:180000.Dialogue: Really? You think I care if a man, what, shared a pumpkin latte with a dynamite lady?

00:12:03:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:03:190000.Dialogue: You are free to believe whatever you like. And unfriend Rajesh Koothrappali.

00:12:12:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:12:050000.Dialogue: Oh, yeah. Now he's gonna miss all those great updates like, I can't believe I waited this long to make my own potpourri

00:12:20:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:20:150000.Dialogue: Sheldon, why don't you just acknowledge that you have feelings for Amy and you don't want her going out with other men?

00:12:29:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:29:130000.Dialogue: Here's a radical thought. Go old-school, challenge Stuart to a fight. I mean, nothing makes the ladies hotter than two skinny white guys swatting at each other with their eyes closed.

00:12:44:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:44:110000.Dialogue: That's all of us. Can I use the laptop?

00:12:47:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:47:080000.Dialogue: I have to buy that stupid collector's tin.

00:12:52:080000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:12:52:080000.Speaker: Penny

00:12:54:080000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:12:54:080000.Speaker: Penny

00:12:55:200000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:12:55:200000.Speaker: Penny

00:12:58:090000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:12:58:090000.Speaker: Penny

00:13:01:090000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:13:01:090000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:13:02:180000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:13:02:180000.Speaker: Penny

00:13:04:130000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:13:04:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:04:130000.Dialogue: I came to ask if you would like to go on a date with me.

00:13:10:040000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:13:10:040000.Speaker: Penny

00:13:12:060000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:13:12:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:12:060000.Dialogue: A date. You and me. Dining, dancing, perhaps you'd like to take in a prizefight.

00:13:20:090000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:13:20:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:20:090000.Dialogue: God, are you trying to make Amy jealous?

00:13:23:060000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:13:23:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:23:060000.Dialogue: No. Why is everyone so obsessed with Amy and Stuart? Whether or not they may be having more pumpkin lattes or intercourse tonight.

00:13:31:180000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:13:31:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:31:180000.Dialogue: Okay, listen to me. Playing games is not gonna help get Amy back.

00:13:37:110000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:13:37:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:37:110000.Dialogue: I am not trying to get her back. But, out of curiosity, what is a way?

00:13:42:220000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:13:42:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:42:220000.Dialogue: All right, honey, let me tell you a story. There was a guy I liked, and I never told him how I felt. Eventually, he started going out with someone else, and I always regretted it. Do you see where I'm going with this?

00:13:54:120000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:13:54:120000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:13:56:030000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:13:56:030000.Speaker: Penny

00:13:57:090000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:13:57:090000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:14:02:170000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:14:02:170000.Speaker: Penny

00:14:04:050000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:14:04:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:04:050000.Dialogue: Are you sure? That would explain so much. Your constant presence in my apartment, that baffling dalliance with Leonard just to be near me, the way you call me sweetie all the time.

00:14:16:150000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:14:16:150000.Speaker: Penny

00:14:17:230000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:14:17:230000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:14:22:040000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:14:22:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:22:040000.Dialogue: Look, Sheldon, all I'm saying is strap on a pair and go talk to Amy.

00:14:25:160000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:14:25:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:25:160000.Dialogue: Strap on a pair? Of what, skates?

00:14:32:040000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:14:32:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:32:040000.Dialogue: Oh, sweetie, you are so not the guy.

00:14:41:200000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:14:41:200000.Speaker: Stuart
00:14:41:200000.Dialogue: If you're bored, you can go. I understand.

00:14:46:080000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:14:46:080000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:46:080000.Dialogue: No, I'm having a nice time.

00:14:49:230000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:14:49:230000.Speaker: Stuart

00:14:54:040000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:14:54:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:54:040000.Dialogue: Excuse me. Excuse me. Pardon me.

00:14:57:160000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:14:57:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:57:160000.Dialogue: Pardon me. Excuse me. Hi, Stuart.

00:15:00:060000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:15:00:060000.Speaker: Stuart

00:15:01:010000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:15:01:010000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:15:07:230000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:15:07:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:07:230000.Dialogue: Sheldon, what are you doing here?

00:15:10:020000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:15:10:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:10:020000.Dialogue: The thought of you sitting in a darkened theater with a character like Stuart is repellent.

00:15:17:160000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:15:17:160000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:15:19:120000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:15:19:120000.Speaker: Stuart
00:15:19:120000.Dialogue: None taken. Although repellent is kind of a... kind of a strong word.

00:15:28:030000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:15:28:030000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:28:030000.Dialogue: I'm sorry this causes you discomfort, but based on the currently established parameters of our relationship, I can put myself in any repellent situation I want.

00:15:37:030000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:15:37:030000.Speaker: Stuart

00:15:38:230000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:15:38:230000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:15:43:100000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:15:43:100000.Speaker: Amy

00:15:45:210000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:15:45:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:45:210000.Dialogue: I believe I would like to alter the paradigm of our relationship.

00:15:54:030000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:15:54:030000.Speaker: Amy

00:15:55:230000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:15:55:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:55:230000.Dialogue: With the understanding that nothing changes whatsoever, physical or otherwise, I would not object to us no longer characterizing you as not my girlfriend.

00:16:16:030000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:16:16:030000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:16:030000.Dialogue: Interesting. Now try it without the quadruple negative.

00:16:21:160000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:16:21:160000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:16:25:010000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:16:25:010000.Speaker: Stuart

00:16:29:040000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:16:29:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:29:040000.Dialogue: Fine. Amy... will you be my girlfriend?

00:16:45:060000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:16:45:060000.Speaker: Amy

00:16:46:060000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:16:46:060000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:16:49:140000.Scene: Penny’s apartment door. Sheldon knocks three times.
00:16:49:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:49:140000.Dialogue: Sorry to interrupt. You two enjoy your date. Here's a dollar for your troubles. Get yourself some Sour Patch Kids.

00:17:02:130000.Speaker: Stuart
00:17:02:130000.Dialogue: So, other than you taking your relationship to the next level with another guy, this was nice.

00:17:12:110000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:12:110000.Dialogue: Yes, well, thanks for seeing me to my door.

00:17:21:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:21:190000.Dialogue: Let's wrap things up out there.

00:17:33:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:33:010000.Dialogue: SHELDON: Take the hint, Stuart. The lady said Good night.

00:17:40:090000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:40:090000.Dialogue: How did you get into my apartment?

00:17:42:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:42:120000.Dialogue: Wow. Is that the kind of nagging I can expect now that you're my girlfriend?

00:17:48:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:48:110000.Dialogue: Good thing I drew this up.

00:17:52:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:52:100000.Dialogue: I present to you the relationship agreement.

00:18:00:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:00:010000.Dialogue: A binding covenant that, in its 31 pages, enumerates, iterates and codifies the rights and responsibilities of Sheldon Lee Cooper, here and after known as the boyfriend, and Amy Farrah Fowler, here and after known as the girlfriend

00:18:25:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:25:220000.Dialogue: Why don't you start perusing while I set up my notary stamp.

00:18:30:070000.Speaker: Amy
00:18:30:070000.Dialogue: Section 5: Hand-holding. Hand-holding is only allowed under the following circumstances. A: Either party is in danger of falling off a cliff, precipice or ledge;

00:18:41:050000.Speaker: Amy
00:18:41:050000.Dialogue: B: Either party is deserving of a hearty handshake after winning a Nobel Prize; C: Moral support during flu shots

00:18:54:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:54:030000.Dialogue: Feel free to retain a lawyer.

00:19:08:140000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. The girls are playing twister.
00:19:08:140000.Speaker: Amy
00:19:08:140000.Dialogue: Penny, I said right hand red.

00:19:10:170000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. The girls are playing twister.
00:19:10:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:10:170000.Dialogue: Yeah, I heard you. I got red.

00:19:14:150000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. The girls are playing twister.
00:19:14:150000.Speaker: Amy

00:19:20:180000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. The girls are playing twister.
00:19:20:180000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:19:20:180000.Dialogue: We should play limbo next. No one beats me at limbo.

00:19:26:030000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. The girls are playing twister.
00:19:26:030000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:19:32:020000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. The girls are playing twister.
00:19:32:020000.Speaker: Amy

00:19:34:170000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. The girls are playing twister.
00:19:34:170000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:19:37:070000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. The girls are playing twister.
00:19:37:070000.Speaker: Amy
00:19:37:070000.Dialogue: What do you want me to do about it?

00:19:40:070000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. The girls are playing twister.
00:19:40:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:40:070000.Dialogue: Relationship agreement Section 4: Boo-boos and Ouchies. You have to take care of it.

00:19:45:030000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. The girls are playing twister.
00:19:45:030000.Speaker: Amy

00:19:50:040000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. The girls are playing twister.
00:19:50:040000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:19:50:040000.Dialogue: Looks like it's just us playing.

00:19:58:220000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. The girls are playing twister.
00:19:58:220000.Speaker: Bernadette

00:20:03:200000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. The girls are playing twister.
00:20:03:200000.Speaker: Bernadette

00:20:05:020000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. The girls are playing twister.
00:20:05:020000.Speaker: Penny
